intro: Ptychotis heterophylla var. longibracteolata, commonly known as the long-bract ptychotis, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky slopes. Its leaves are variable in shape, often lobed or divided, and its flowers are small and clustered in umbels.
